results.title: The Shawshank redemption
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Niki Marvin and Frank Darabont
results.brief_description: An unforgettable story of hope, friendship and survival inside a maximum security gaol. Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a New England banker convicted of murdering his wife and her lover, is sent to Shawshank State Prison where he meets “Red” Redding (Morgan Freeman), a seasoned lifer. Despite twenty years on the inside, the prison bars fail to contain their spirits and the pair forge an unlikely friendship that overcomes pain, suffering and ultimately leads to a chance at freedom.

results.title: The Shaggy dog
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Charles Barton, Walt Disney and Bill Walsh
results.brief_description: Family comedy film around the theme of fantasy and magic. The discovery of a magic ring changed young Wilby Daniels’ (Tommy Kirk) life forever. Suddenly he could transform himself into a large sheepdog - but the problem was he had no control as to when this was going to happen. Wilby did not need this in his life right now, just when he had his eye on the rather pretty Allison (Annette Funicello). He had to break the spell and the only way to do that was by performing some virtuous deed. Cast also includes Fred MacMurray, Jean Hagen, Tim Considine.

results.title: The Shaggy D.A.
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Anderson and Robert Stevenson
results.brief_description: Sequel to Disney’s “The Shaggy Dog” (released 17 years earlier), this family comedy is full of slapstick moments and a plot that takes you from the world of reality to the fantastic and bizarre. Dean Jones stars as the now grown-up Wilby Daniels, who is campaigning to become a district attorney and Keenan Wynn plays his villainous arch-rival, John Slade. The campaign is turned on its head when Daniels is transformed into a sheepdog and Slade into a disgruntled bulldog and it becomes a contest between the two canines. Cast also includes Tim Conway, Suzanne Pleshette, Jo Ann Worley.

results.title: The Seventh seal
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, Allan Ekelund and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description: Ingmar Bergman’s “Seventh seal” deserves its reputation as a benchmark in the lexicon of modern cinema. With striking imagery, captivating characters and deep philosophical arguments Bergman weaves a rich tapestry as only a master can. Set in the middle ages in the midst of the plague, Antonius Block (Max Von Sydow) is a knight returning from the crusades. When Death (Bengt Ekerot) appears before him he suggests a game of chess to forestall his fate. He travels to his home with an assortment of characters, including his atheist squire Jons (Gunnar Bjornstrand) and a troupe of travelling players. Despite it’s metaphysical content “The Seventh Seal” also includes a heavy dose of Scandinavian humour. In Swedish with english subtitles.

results.title: The Seven year itch
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Charles K. Feldman and Billy Wilder
results.brief_description: A husband of seven years, alone in New York while his family is on vacation, fantasises an affair with the TV model in the upstairs apartment and develops “The seven year itch”. Tortured by guilt, he envisions so many dire consequences that he finally runs off to join his wife. Tom Ewell and Marilyn Monroe star in this tremendous comedy. Based on the play by George Axelrod.

results.title: The Servant
results.creator_credit: Springbok Films, Joseph Losey and Norman Priggen
results.brief_description: A socio-psychological drama in which a servant, Barratt, is hired by an upper-class, self-centred young man, who has moved into a new house at Chelsea where he plans to live with his fiancee after their marriage. Gradually the relationship of servant and master changes as the latter finds himself slowly falling under Barratt’s control Harold Pinter’s superb study of brooding hatred and hypocrisy within the ever-shifting borders of the class struggle is based on the novel ‘The Servant’ by Robin Maugham. Music by John Dankworth. Cast: Dirk Bogarde, Sarah Miles, Wendy Craig, James Fox.

results.title: The Secret of Roan Inish
results.creator_credit: Peter Newman Productions, Sarah Green, Maggie Renzi and John Sayles
results.brief_description: The Coneelly family, now living on the isolated west coast of Ireland, has been displaced from Roan Inish, the small, mysterious island which they shared with herds of seals. Fiona is sent to live there with her grandparents and becomes determined to penetrate the secrets of her family’s mysterious past and the legends they all embrace. Cast includes Mick Lally, Eileen Colgan, John Lynch and Jeni Courtney.

results.title: The Secret of Nimh 2: Timmy to the rescue
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Paul Sabella, Jonathan Dern and Dick Sebast
results.brief_description: Jonathan Brisby, the bravest of all rats died in saving his fellow creatures from the evil clutches of NIMH. Once escaped, the rats made a home for themselves in Thorn Valley. It was predicted that one day the forces of NIMH would rise again and the son of Jonathan Brisby would save them; the destiny of rats lies with Timmy Brisby. Feeling the pressure to be the hero his father was, Timmy begins his journey with Jeremy the crow where he is placed under the tutelage of Mr Ages and fellow elders who equip him with the tools to face his destiny. A female rat called Jenny makes it to the village and implores them to return to NIMH with her and save the rats from the evil Doctor Valentine. The council decides against helping her however, and when Timmy discovers elder brother Martin is a prisoner at NIMH, he and Jenny decide to save the rats themselves. Made for television 16 years after the original and features musical numbers. Features the voices of Dom DeLuise, Eric Idle, Ralph Macchio, William H. Macy and Hynden Walch. Narrated by Peter MacNicoll.

results.title: The Secret of Nimh [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Aurora, Don Bluth and Gary Goldman
results.brief_description: The story of timid Mrs Brisby, a widowed field mouse who must summon the courage to defy man, beast and nature against the imminent destruction of her home before Farmer Fitzgibbon’s spring plowing. With the help of love-sick Jeremy the crow and the mysterious rats of NIMH (super intelligent creatures residing in the farmer’s rosebush), she finds the strength to overcome the obstacles that threaten her family. Based on the story by Robert C. O’Brien.

results.title: The Secret life of Walter Mitty
results.brief_description: Walter Mitty is a dreamer. To escape the humdrum of his life and his shrewish mother, Walter’s secret life is rich and exciting by comparison. Walter’s daydream personnas include a western gunslinger, a world-famous surgeon, a RAF pilot and a Mississippi river boat gambler. A mysterious and beautiful blonde is always by his side. Suddenly Walter is thrust into a real-life adventure when he comes to the rescue of a ravishing blonde trying to escape a gang of jewel thieves. Danny Kaye brings all his comic genius into the role of Walter Mitty and is supported by Boris Karloff and Virginia Mayo. Based on the renown short story by James Thurber, this is a comic fantasy which can be enjoyed by all.
